cc_function: FUNCTION: Catalytic subunit of mitochondrial acetolactate synthase, which catalyzes the first of a series of common steps in the biosynthesis of the branched-chain amino acids. Catalyzes the irreversible decarboxylation of pyruvate to a bound hydroxyethyl group that then condenses with either a second pyruvate molecule to form 2-acetolactate (AL) or with 2-ketobutyrate to form 2-aceto-2-hydroxybutyrate (AHB). The first product is the precursor for valine and leucine biosynthesis, while the second leads to isoleucine. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:10213630}.
kinetics: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  Kinetic parameters: KM=8.6 mM for pyruvate (catalytic subunit only) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10213630}; KM=18.1 mM for pyruvate (reconstituted into the acetolactate synthase complex with the regulatory subunit) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10213630};
cc_pathway: PATHWAY: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-isoleucine biosynthesis; L-isoleucine from 2-oxobutanoate: step 1/4. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:10213630}.; PATHWAY: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-valine biosynthesis; L-valine from pyruvate: step 1/4. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:10213630}.
ph_dependence: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  pH dependence: Optimum pH is 7-7.5. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:10213630};

protein_name: Acetolactate synthase large subunit IlvB1 (ALS) (EC 2.2.1.6) (Acetohydroxy-acid synthase large subunit) (AHAS)
lineage: Mycobacterium tuberculosis (species), Mycobacterium tuberculosis complex (no rank), Mycobacterium (genus), Mycobacteriaceae (family), Corynebacteriales (order), Actinomycetia (class), Actinobacteria (phylum), Terrabacteria group (no rank), Bacteria (superkingdom), cellular organisms (no rank)
cc_catalytic_activity: CATALYTIC ACTIVITY: Reaction=H(+) + 2 pyruvate = (2S)-2-acetolactate + CO2; Xref=Rhea:RHEA:25249, ChEBI:CHEBI:15361, ChEBI:CHEBI:15378, ChEBI:CHEBI:16526, ChEBI:CHEBI:58476; EC=2.2.1.6; Evidence={ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690};
cc_cofactor: COFACTOR: Name=Mg(2+); Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:18420; Evidence={ECO:0000250}; Note=Binds 1 Mg(2+) ion per subunit. {ECO:0000250}; COFACTOR: Name=thiamine diphosphate; Xref=ChEBI:CHEBI:58937; Evidence={ECO:0000250}; Note=Binds 1 thiamine pyrophosphate per subunit. {ECO:0000250};
cc_function: FUNCTION: Catalyzes the conversion of 2 pyruvate molecules into acetolactate in the first common step of the biosynthetic pathway of the branched-amino acids such as leucine, isoleucine, and valine. Also involved in condensing pyruvate and 2-ketobutyrate to form 2-aceto-2-hydroxybutyrate. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690}.
kinetics: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  Kinetic parameters: KM=2.76 mM for pyruvate (with the catalytic subunit alone at pH 7.5 and at 37 degrees Celsius) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690}; KM=1.56 mM for pyruvate (with the catalytic and regulatory subunits at pH 7.5 and at 37 degrees Celsius) {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690};
cc_pathway: PATHWAY: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-isoleucine biosynthesis; L-isoleucine from 2-oxobutanoate: step 1/4.; PATHWAY: Amino-acid biosynthesis; L-valine biosynthesis; L-valine from pyruvate: step 1/4.
temp_dependence: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  Temperature dependence: Optimum temperature is between 35 and 40 degrees Celsius. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690};
ph_dependence: BIOPHYSICOCHEMICAL PROPERTIES:  pH dependence: Optimum pH is between 6 and 7. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:16111681, ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690};

cc_subunit: SUBUNIT: Heterodimer of large catalytic subunit and small regulatory subunit. {ECO:0000305|PubMed:16111681}.
cc_induction: INDUCTION: The expression is high during the mid-exponential phase and low during the stationary phase. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:20884690}.

cc_disruption_phenotype: DISRUPTION PHENOTYPE: Auxotrophic for all of the 3 branched-chain amino acids (isoleucine, leucine and valine), when grown with either C6 or C2 carbon sources. Depletion of these branched chain amino acids in the medium led to loss of viability. {ECO:0000269|PubMed:19542000}.
